alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 9:48AM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches in the Scott and Klamath River Valleys, but 6 to 12 inches over the higher terrain. * WHERE...All of Western Siskiyou County. This includes Sawyers Bar Road, Etna Summit, and most of Highway 3 and Highway 96. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour at times, especially this morning, will cause significantly reduced visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
